tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE library_books (
id INT PRIMARY KEY,
book_title VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
author VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
publication_year INT,
quantity INT,
availability BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE library_books (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(255),
    author VARCHAR(255),
    genre VARCHAR(50),
    quantity INT
);

CREATE TABLE circulation_records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    book_id INT,
    borrower_id INT,
    checkout_date DATE,
    return_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE books (
    book_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(255),
    author VARCHAR(100),
    isbn VARCHAR(50),
    availability BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE borrowers (
    borrower_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    borrower_name VARCHAR(100),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    phone_number VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE loans (
    loan_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    book_id INT,
    borrower_id INT,
    loan_date DATE,
    return_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE books (
    book_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(255),
    author VARCHAR(255),
    category VARCHAR(50),
    publication_year INT,
    quantity INT
);

CREATE TABLE BookInventory (
    book_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(255),
    author VARCHAR(255),
    genre VARCHAR(50),
    publish_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE BookCopies (
    copy_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    book_id INT,
    library_id INT,
    availability BOOLEAN,
    FOREIGN KEY (book_id) REFERENCES BookInventory(book_id)
)

CREATE TABLE LibraryBranches (
    library_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    location VARCHAR(255),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15)
)

CREATE TABLE CirculationRecords (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    copy_id INT,
    borrower_id INT,
    check_out_date DATE,
    due_date DATE,
    check_in_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (copy_id) REFERENCES BookCopies(copy_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Borrowers (
    borrower_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    phone_number VARCHAR(15)
)
